item.title: Setting Up Active Directory Network From Scratch
item.description: Introduction This blog post will show step by step how to setup a basic Active Directory network. The network will consist of four computers, two servers and two clients. There will be a Domain Controller, a DHCP server, a central management station, and of course a desktop for the clients. This can all be seen in the diagram below. The purpose of the central management desktop for the administrator to easily manage multiple servers at once.
